description.narrative: 1.1 Enhanced knowledge on the most recent religious attitudes and behaviors of students, teachers and university students 1.2 Enhanced knowledge on the most recent degree of students, teachers and university studentsâ€™ support for radicalism or radical religious movements, pro-violence ideologies and extremism 2.1 The increase of public policies to prevent the spread of certain attitudes and violent behavior, extremism and radicalism in schools, university and colleges and other educational institutions 2.2 The increased involvement of students, teachers and communities in counteracting the spread of certain attitudes and violent behavior, extremism and radicalism 3.1 The widespread of tolerant, open and peaceful religious values to strengthen Indonesian inclusive society 3.2 The increased public awareness on the importance of tolerant, open and peaceful religious values to strengthen Indonesian inclusive society 4.1 Projects plans smoothly implemented and financial accountability ensured 4.2 Results of the project shared with government, civil societies, development partners, and other Asian countries

comment.narrative: 1.1 4 available researches (2008, 2010, 2011, 2015) 1.2 4 available researches (2008, 2010, 2011, 2015) 2.1 4 advocacy events (2011, 2014, 2015, 2016) 2.2 4 policy engagement activities (2011, 2014, 2015, 2016) 3.1 3 youth camp program (2011, 2013, 2015) None conducted by UNDP 3.2 3 media campaign events (2011, 2013, 2015) None distributed UNDP 4.1 Projects plans smoothly implemented and financial accountability ensured: 0 4.2 Results of the project shared with government, civil societies, development partners, and other Asian countries: 0

Output 1 Development of evidence-based knowledge through research and survey on Countering Violent Extremism in a gender sensitive approach: 1.1 Enhanced knowledge on the most recent religious attitudes and behaviors of students, teachers and university students and 1.2 Enhanced knowledge on the most recent degree of students, teachers and university studentsâ€™ support for radicalism or radical religious movements, pro-violence ideologies and extremism.
Output 2 Strengthened Advocacy and Policy Engagement on Countering Violent Extremism: 2.1 The increase of public policies to prevent the spread of certain attitudes and violent behavior, extremism and radicalism in schools, university and colleges and other educational institutions and 2.2 The increased involvement of students, teachers and communities in counteracting the spread of certain attitudes and violent behavior, extremism and radicalism.
Output 3 Increased public awareness and knowledge on Countering Violent Extremism: 3.1 The widespread of tolerant, open and peaceful religious values to strengthen Indonesian inclusive society and 3.2 The increased public awareness on the importance of tolerant, open and peaceful religious values to strengthen Indonesian inclusive society.
Output 4 Project implementation quality is assured and proper coordination mechanism established among relevant stakeholders: 4.1 Projects plans smoothly implemented and financial accountability ensured and 4.2 Results of the project shared with government, civil societies, development partners, and other Asian countries.

Output 1: Project is taking its necessary steps to develop evidence-based knowledge as indicated by: - Enhance knowledge on the most recent religious attitudes and behaviors of students, teachers and university students throug completion and dissemination on results of one national survey and two research (Islamic Literature and Social Media), completion of data collection completion for one research and one database.
Ouput 2: Project is taking its necessary steps to strengthen advocacy and policy engagement on CVE as indicated by: - The increase of public policies to prevent the spread of certain attitudes and violent behavior, extremism and radicalism in schools, university and colleges and other educational institutions through completion and dissemination of results on seven assessment for P/CVE programs. - The increased involvement of d communities in counteracting the spread of certain attitudes and violent behavior, extremism and radicalism through two policy engagement activities have been conducted; reintegration programs for former detainees, GAFATAR and NII, and development of early warning system for local security actors in East Java.
Output 3: Project is taking its necessary steps to increase public awareness and knowledge on CVE as indicated by: - The widespread of tolerant, open and peaceful religious values to strengthen Indonesian inclusive society through two trainings on P/CVE through boardgame and social media as well as circulation of 18 editions of weekly bulletin to 100 mosques and prayer room in Greater Jakarta Area. - Campaigns on P/CVE conducted through various social media channel including websites, Twitter, Instagram, Facebook to increase public awareness on the importance of tolerant, open and peaceful religious values to strengthen Indonesian inclusive society.
Output 4: Quality of project implementation is continuously being assured and proper coordination mechanism among relevant stakeholders has been established, as indicate

description.narrative: Energy - policy, planning and administration

A. Increased area of sustainably managed production integrating biodiversity conservation in one forested and three coastal landscapes
B. Increased number of producers participating in community based adaptive landscape planning and management in one forested and three coastal landscapes
C. Increased number of communities, within the one forested and three coastal landscapes, participating in capacity development activities, to improve the social and financial sustainability of their organizations.
D. Increased number of knowledge sharing events and products

comment.narrative:
5,000 ha sustainably managed in the one forested and three coastal landscapes
500 producers participating in community based landscape planning and management processes
500 livestock producers trained in silvopastoral systems
25 CSO representatives participating in trainings to improve the financial and administrative sustainability their community organizations

1. Develop a participatory landscapes strategy with community and related stakeholders 2. Develop a village-level and inter-village level agreement to support the implementation of the strategy 3. Develop community-based policy platforms on natural resources management with the community, local government and other related stakeholders 4. Develop a practical knowledge system at the grassroots level that would connect groups to facilitate well-documented information dissemination, including lessons learned among other groups or communities. For example, this network could share knowledge related to local folk songs, dancing, or other elements of traditional culture 5. Technical assistance to community organizations for grant project design;

Due to delay in CSO partners' engagement, project landscape strategy at 4 project demonstration sites have not yet been finalized. Until end of 2017, the project team and CSOs' partners are still developing the draft strategies through bottom up process involving key local government institutions, community leaders and community groups representative as well as considering gender balance in the data collection, planning and decision making process. With this stage of implementation, other 2017 expected outputs will be rescheduled in mid 2018 including village level and inter-village agreement; community-based policy platforms and development of practical knowledge system. Once strategies were developed, the project will facilitate the CBOs and local NGOs on proposal development/grant project design.
